page.title: 07THE EXMOOR FLOODS
page.content: Between 11.30 am. on August 15th. 1952 and 9.30 am. on August 16th, nine inches of rain was recorded on the Chains.It has been estimated that this amounted to over three billon gallons of water. Every combe running off the Chains was awash, the narrow high sided combes caused the water to create tidal waves. The River Barle brought floods to Simonsbath and Withypool, the River Exe caused flooding in Exford and Dulverton, but the greatest disaster was caused by the beautiful Lyn rivers, East and West. They carried tons of water, boulders and trees onto the village of Lynmouth. They caused two million pounds worth of damage and the deaths of thirty people.
